pageProps.readme:
bradtaniguchi-dev

This repo represents my portfolio/blog site that is hosted on github-pages.

This repo will be updated to replace the current one at: https://github.com/bradtaniguchi/bradtaniguchi.github.io

Which uses a custom domain at: https://bradtaniguchi.dev/

Project road-map

roadmap

License

MIT

issue.title: Fixed race condition on first start-up
issue.body:
I noticed I'm getting an error of "Connection is closed" on first starting up the express Node app. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48596856/185441925-11966849-70d5-4243-b5e2-a6a5e0b3c219.png)
The store functions properly and all works well, but it is an annoying error that always shows up on app-start up. After testing it out, it seems like it's a race condition, and adding a small delay of 0.05 seconds fixes this issue. That is what this PR is for.

comment.body: Glad to hear you figured it out 👍🏼 and also thanks for reaching out to contribute to the library regardless of the outcome 😄

issue.title: Fixed race condition on first start-up
issue.body:
I noticed I'm getting an error of "Connection is closed" on first starting up the express Node app. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48596856/185441925-11966849-70d5-4243-b5e2-a6a5e0b3c219.png)
The store functions properly and all works well, but it is an annoying error that always shows up on app-start up. After testing it out, it seems like it's a race condition, and adding a small delay of 0.05 seconds fixes this issue. That is what this PR is for.

comment.body:
Thanks for providing those pieces of code! 

I have a few more questions.

Does your server start initially on a request, or does it "sit waiting" 24/7 and the code never has to restart.

I ask primarily to cover the scenario where the server is starting up and **immediately** gets hit by a session check for a request, at which point the connection to MYSQL might not be setup yet. This sort of setup is more common in situations where the code is running on infrastructure that scales up and down often.

You originally mentioned that this error appears on startup, but I'd like to understand what circumstances are included in that "startup". 

Thanks!

issue.title: [chore] Clean up repo tooling

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
I found a few things we can improve on the tooling/development side if we are to put this repo into a more "maintenance" mode moving forward.

- [x] Add `.nvmrc` and update docs to specify which version of nodejs we should develop on and are tested against.
- [ ] Add github-action pipeline to run some sanity checks against the repo
- [x] Update `package.json` with `rimraf` rather than windows specific `rimdir`, will allow for linux based development, even though this library generally is used on windows.
- [x] Add `clean` and `build` commands for developer accessibility 
- [ ]  Add contributing docs
- [ ] Add `typedoc` based github page deployment. Will help with documenting the current codebase, rather than the current README based setup
- [ ] Add `.vscode` specific files, primarily for extensions we should install (gitpod might already have some)

comment.body:
TO support github-action checks, we might be able to leverage:
https://github.com/marketplace/actions/mssql-suite

this should allow us to install and setup a test-suite environment during a github-action pipeline without much work.

commits.message:
chore: remove node version 10 from test run

- 10 is no longer supported. Neither is 12, but we can test against it
  for now.
fix: on-push lint and test steps

issue.title: Fixed race condition on first start-up
issue.body:
I noticed I'm getting an error of "Connection is closed" on first starting up the express Node app. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48596856/185441925-11966849-70d5-4243-b5e2-a6a5e0b3c219.png)
The store functions properly and all works well, but it is an annoying error that always shows up on app-start up. After testing it out, it seems like it's a race condition, and adding a small delay of 0.05 seconds fixes this issue. That is what this PR is for.

issue.title: [chore] Clean up repo tooling
issue.body:
I found a few things we can improve on the tooling/development side if we are to put this repo into a more "maintenance" mode moving forward.

- [ ] Add `.nvmrc` and update docs to specify which version of nodejs we should develop on and are tested against.
- [ ] Add github-action pipeline to run some sanity checks against the repo
- [ ] Update `package.json` with `rimraf` rather than windows specific `rimdir`, will allow for linux based development, even though this library generally is used on windows.
- [ ] Add `clean` and `build` commands for developer accessibility 
- [ ]  Add contributing docs
- [ ] Add `typedoc` based github page deployment. Will help with documenting the current codebase, rather than the current README based setup

commits.message:
Updateeslintconfig (#30)

* disabled eslint rule no-undef. Was not seeing Express namespace for interfaces. REmoved error and method arguments from errorHandler callback for .once.

* Updated all packages -- @types/mssql, @typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin, @typescript-eslint/parser, and eslint-config-airbnb-typescript
wrapped tests in namespace (#33)
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/JLuboff/connect-mssql-v2

docs: Fix a couple of typos (#35)

Signed-off-by: nhcarrigan <nhcarrigan@gmail.com>

Update/package temp (#37)

* Updated Express.SessionData to SessionData (desctructured from express-session types)

* Updated packages to latest versions

* [TEMP] Changed minor imports

I think there are a few things wrong still, but this seems like the
right way to go about it.

* re-added connect argument

* Fix compile issue

* Moved top level disable comments from store.ts to eslint file

* Removed eslint disable comments. Corrected comments for methods where jsdoc was not showing method description. Removed unneeded try/catch from initializeDatabase method.

* Removed encapsulation around MSSQLStore. No longer require passing in session store.

* Updated to account for changes made to store.ts

* v2.0.0

Co-authored-by: brad taniguchi <bradtaniguchi@gmail.com>
Removed typing warning
Added v1.x.x to v2.x.x upgrade section

Fix for #47 + Peer Dep updates (#49)

* Added 'await' to return statement to clear eslint warning

* Created jest config file to force use jest-jasmine2 as the testrunner as opposed to jest-circus

* Added coverage folder to git ignore

* Added options:{ trustServerCertificates: true} to sql config in tests to allow for local dev environment tests

* Added module.exports to allow for using require statement and not needing to target default export

* JS file test to verify require statement is working

* Include js file for test file purposes

* Added notes on required database user permissions and SQL config options update to account for breaking changes made to mssql package

* v2.1.0

* v2.1.0

* Add space to comments

Co-authored-by: Brad <bradtaniguchi@gmail.com>

* Added section for upgrading from v2.x.x to v3.x.x

* Reformatted/linted

* Added airbnb-base to extends

* v3.0.0

* v3.0.0

Co-authored-by: Brad <bradtaniguchi@gmail.com>
Added/Editted Bug Report Template
Update issue templates
Removed async/await within test and used expect within callback of the outer function

Refactor (#52)

* Replaced ready method with dbReadyCheck method. dbReadyCheck is an async method as opposed to a method expecting a callback

* Moved reused code for checking expiration to its own method. Renamed session to currentSession due to needing to pull in session namespace for Cookie typings

* Renamed interface from IMSSQLStore to MSSQLStoreDef as to remove I prefix

* Created queryRunner method to handle running all queries. Updated methods to use queryRunner as opposed to running queries within themselves

* Remove dbReadyCheck from each method and instead run within queryRunner

* Cleaned up return statements to use ternarys as needed

* Wrote test for clear method

* Added deprecation warning for IMSSQLStore interface. Removed connecting check in dbReadyCheck

* Added some missing comments

* Changed typing from any to Function for destroyExpired callback and made it optional (thus matching the typings in the interface)

* Removed return from methods as expected to not return anything (void). Updated return type typings from void to Promise<void> as methods are now async

* Changed inputParameters to POJO instead of an (unneeded) array

Update tmux config

- now the left side isn't as large
